name: Park Hotel Clarke Quay

reviews.text: I have used Park Hotel Clarke Q in Singapore many times now both for business and for leisure and it is a very nice hotel with excellent service. I have a Company account now and use to make the reservation on Crystal Club level which is very nice with separate breakfast for club guests, afternoon tea and a small buffe in the evening.
reviews.title: Perfect location in Singapore

reviews.text: The staff on club level are very friendly and service minded, this hotel has become my second home now.
reviews.title: Crystal Club well worth it

reviews.text: I have just returned from two weeks in a Crystal Club Superior room. As other reviewers have stated, the room is small (24sqm). I would have struggled for two weeks if I had another person in the room. The rooms were well set out and scrupulously clean as room service comes twice a day.
reviews.title: Good hotel... not totally five star but it's not totally a five star price either.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The package was excellent value for money in Singapore. Daily I got breakfast, two items of laundry, unlimited internet, afternoon tea and two hours for drinks and canapés in the evening.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Great Location - Would Definitely Return

reviews.text: The area had lots of restaurant choices and was a ten minute walk to Clark Quay MRT. I took a taxi to Science Park every morning and never had to wait as there are taxis at the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 2 week stay in de luxe on room only basis. Agree rooms on smallish size - could have done with a tad more cupbpoard space but we coped with no problem. Standards of cleanliness first class and daily change of bedding. Pool good and no problem with sunbeds - only thing is the hotel is favoured for weddings and so at weekends may well find the terrace bar is taken over, but you can still use the pool. All staff extremely courteous and helpful. Ate in restaurant one evening food ok but expensive and with so many restaurants and food markets around then you need to get out. Location excellent and easy to get around by taxi bus or MRT. If you come out of hotel lobby turn left and left again you will come to the river. Turn left and under bridge and you get safely (no road to cross!) to Clarke Quay and beyond to Boat Quay if you want, both very lively and noisy, but hotel far enough away to be quiet. If you turn right and follow the river path and under bridge then on right at end of apartment block you will find an excellent place for breakfast -Kith's. Real bacon and leaf tea not tea bags and favoured by the expat wives! If you are into veggie breakfast and juices thern go up Unity Street to junction with Sultan Mohammed and on left a great little cafe, forgotten the name
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good location

reviews.text: we were upgraded to Crystal Club on the tenth floor. Everyone is friendly. Convenient location to Chinatown, Orchard road and many other locations. View is fantastic.
reviews.title: very nice hotel, very good location

reviews.text: To all the staff at The PArk hotel thanks, especially BAla,Alex and Sam who assisted us with our parents and made our stay great.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at breakfast was supurb. It is agreat place to stay .Thanks Guys and Gals.
reviews.title: Very good hotel close to Clarke quay (riverside area in Singapore)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The driver of the courtesy bus was very helpful to my aging parents
reviews.title: Brilliant location, nice hotel

reviews.text: I have been to Singapore numerous times for holidays over the years, and have stayed in a wide range of accommodation from YMCA to top-notch hotels on Orchard. Park Hotel Clarke Quay is by far the best I have ever stayed in. We were there for 2 nights from New Year's eve. I made a booking months ahead so the rate is not high at all for a hotel of this standard (<S$200 per night plus tax) at this time of the year. We arrived from Sri Lanka by a very early morning flight. With the previous evening being Dec 30 and NY's eve upcoming, I honestly did not expect an early check-in. To our surprise, the reception staff was very accommodating (perhaps noting that we looked horrible after only 2-3 hours' sleep on the flight) and let us have an early check at 10am!
reviews.title: Top choice so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is very clean, modern, adequate (though I agree it's a bit small for 2 people) and is quiet albeit we actually stayed on the 2nd floor next to the pool!
reviews.title: Nice staff, good location.

reviews.text: We did not eat there so I can't comment. I did swim and the experience is delightful.
reviews.title: Business or pleasure

reviews.text: Free shuttle service is available to Clarke Quay MRT and Orchard. Though infrequent (around once in an hour) it's good enough for connection to main business and tourist spots without hussle. Taxi fare (daytime) costs no more than S$5 to China Town, and around S$20 from airport.
reviews.title: Let's park! At Park Hotel Clarke Quay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely stay here again unless the rate scars me off.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay at Park Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park Hotel was situated just a 5 minute walk from some lovely bars and clubs! Very expensive but worth it! If you like clubbing go to Zouk! Buy a lonely planet guide too. The hotel was great, amazing views, we did not get breakfast, but across the road there is a starbucks and a deli france. Great for a 3 night stay! We would go back in a flash. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Loved Singapore!

reviews.text: As other reviewers have said this hotel is modern, very clean, in a good location and the staff that we encountered were all without exception very helpful and efficient. The rooms are well fitted out with quality linen and towels etc but they really are small - especially if you are not a couple and would like a bit more space. I was surprised that our room did not have free wi fi access although it was available in the lobby area you have to give your laptop to the reception staff to type in the code which seemed a bit strange. Didn't eat here as the food and drink is very expensive (as with a lot of Singapore) however Subway in the mall opposite does a basic breakfast deal for 4 Singapore dollars and there is free tea and coffee in the room. All in all given the prices in general for Singapore we felt we got a fair deal at £60 per room per night. The complimentary shuttle bus is very useful for getting around and saves you a bit of money as will eating out in the many local food stalls and cafes just around the corner or in central Singapore. Would recommend at the right price.
reviews.title: Very good - let down by room size though...

reviews.text: Whilst in Singapore we stayed 4 nights at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay. The staff were in EVERY area of service in the hotel absolutely TOP - polite, efficient and fast in answering any query we may have had. The breakfast room was very efficiently run and the choice of food excellent. The rooms were also top. Super clean bathroom and fresh towels daily.
reviews.title: Top service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing which bothered us was the size of the room. We were on a business and pleasure trip throughout Asia and therefore found it difficult to find space for our two suitcases plus two board cases. Also the wardrobe was much too small. We agree with minimalizing where possible these days but all hotels should offer enough space for travellers baggage und its contents. We had a problem finding a space to put the suitcases and to find our belongings in that too small a wardrobe.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise everything about the Park Hotel suited us very well. The pool was excellent and towels were to be had in plenty.The location was super. Many restaurants almost just in front of the door and lovely walks along the busy and interesting Quay in the evenings..
reviews.title: Rooms bit small

description: With classic architecture inspired by Singapore’s colonial past, Park Hotel Clarke Quay is a tropical retreat in the heart of the city, conveniently located next to the entertainment and dining hub of Clarke Quay and the iconic Singapore River. Enjoy sweeping views of the city skyline and the river from the hotel’s 336 rooms and suites. Pampering facilities including a 25m outdoor pool and adjoining Jacuzzi, a spectacular deck and bar and cabana style spa pavilions – perfect additions to an ideal getaway.
